intro: Myosotis stricta var. speluncicola, commonly known as the cave forget-me-not, is a rare and specialized plant species adapted to subterranean environments. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, pale blue or white flowers, which are typically hidden within dark, humid caves. The plant thrives in nutrient-poor, shaded conditions and relies on specific microclimates for survival. Its leaves are usually thick and fleshy, helping it retain moisture in its arid, underground habitat. Due to its limited distribution and fragile ecosystem, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
